resources.string: Here you will find information on how to use Scripter and it\'s features. \nFor more information, visit our website.

When writing your script: 
 -Write your script in the JavaScript programming language.
 -Do not add comments. 
 -Specify dependencies/triggers for specific state changes. Otherwise your script will run when any state changes. 
 -See the example script below for layout guideline. This example script opens the devices music player if the users headphones are plugged in on a weekday.

The following states are available for you to use when writing your scripts:
 STATES 
 -minute 
 -hour 
 -month 
 -year 
 -dayOfMonth 
 -dayOfWeek 
 -headphonesPluggedIn 
 -latitude 
 -longitude 
 -wifiConnected 
 -SSID 
 
 FUNCTIONS 
 -toastMessage 
 -openCamera 
 -openMusicPlayer 
 -isWeekday 
 -isWeekend 
 -openWebpage 
 -displayNotification 
 -withinMeterRadiusOf 
 -turnOnSilent 
 -turnOnVibrate 
 -turnOnSound 
 -isOnSilent 
 -isOnVibrate 
 -isOnSound 
 -sendSMS
1. Create your script and store it online.
2. Open Scripter and hit the Download button.
3. Enter your scripts URL, give it a name, and download.
4. Ensure your script is enabled in the script list.
5. Hit the green Start button to start yur scripts! (Scripter will now run in the background of your device)
6. Hit the red Stop button to disable your scripts!
7. Hold down on the script to delete, rename, re-download and view the code online.
